sentences.en: A vacant plot of land adjoins his house.
sentences.cn: 有一块空地紧挨着他家。

sentences.en: Daya Bay Nuclear Power Station ( GNPS ) and Ling Ao Nuclear Power Station ( LNPS ) adjoin each other.
sentences.cn: 大亚湾核电站 ( GNPS ) 和岭澳核电站 ( LNPS ) 毗邻而建.

sentences.en: Generally this means having only adjoin the word or words that it limits.
sentences.cn: 一般来说,这意味着把only放在被限定词的旁边.

sentences.en: I do adjoin a copy of the letter that I have received ( John Fowles )
sentences.cn: 我确实在收到的信中加了一副本 ( 约翰福尔斯 )

sentences.en: If the enclosing sides adjoin each other, the area should be properly vented.
sentences.cn: 如果封闭的侧面彼此邻接, 该区域要有适当的通风.

sentences.en: It is forbidden to adjoin to a postcard any sample of merchandise.
sentences.cn: 在明信片上附贴商品的样品是不许可的.

sentences.en: Section of an integrated chip. Adjoin with other sections.
sentences.cn: 集成芯片的部分. 与其他部分邻接.

sentences.en: The geographical condition of our factory is superior, adjoin the harbour of Tianjin!
sentences.cn: 本厂地理条件优越, 毗邻天津港!

trans.tran_en: to be next to or joined to sth

trans.tran_cn: 邻近，毗连，接，贴连，附加，使结合
